12131.content: Someone shrinks because of Gravity Falls weirdness, or maybe they were just born small?
12131.title: Shrink

121312.content: So who is our lucky born tiny? How about Dipper?
121312.title: Gravity Falls Born Shrunk

1213121.content:
(Prelude: Dipper is a minizora. They're people born 1 in a million and can be 3 to 5 inches tall. They're durable enough to be stepped on and even survive stomach acid, but not invincible. Based on the story by https://www.writing.com/main/interactive...)

Dipper had had an eventful last few hours to say the least. After being dropped off by their folks in this tourist trap town, he and his sister Mabel had a bit of an incident. And by incident, he’s obviously referring to Mabel being kidnapped and almost forced into marriage with 1,000 gnomes, followed by an epic chase in a golf cart from a composite gnome monster, and ending with the defeat of said monster with a leaf blower. However, now that the adrenaline had fallen and they were up in the attic for the evening, Dipper took greater interest with his initial big discovery: a mysterious journal with a six fingered hand on the cover. Of particular interest to the three inch tall boy was that the book was sized to minizora like himself.

“What’ch’ya readin’ there, bro-bro?” asked Mabel. The regular sized twelve year old was hanging upside down off the edge of her bed. She wore her usual purple sleeping sweater as her feet kicked idly in the air.

“The journal about the mysteries of Gravity Falls,” Dipper explained. “You know, the one I showed you a few hours ago back when I thought the gnomes were actually a zombie.”

Mabel gave a snorting laugh. “Yeah. Great job being the smart twin. Can’t even tell the difference between gnomes and zombies.”

Dipper narrowed his eyes on his sister. “Oh yeah? Well you followed a strange guy you’d only just met out into the woods where anything could have happened! Honestly, it turning out to be gnomes was pretty lucky on your end.”

“Hey, it’s not my fault! I thought he was a vampire.”

“And that makes it better?”

Mabel folded her arms and turned away in a huff, still upside-down. “I won’t even dignify that with a response.”

“He’s been out in the sun all day wearing only a hoodie,” reminded Dipper.

“He could be using super vampire sunblock. You don’t know,” Mabel whined.

“Mabel, that makes literally no sense.”

“Sure it does. In fact, I know how to settle this. You’ve got a journal full of weird stuff, right? Go ahead and check.”

Dipper gave a soft chuckle as he flipped through the pages. “You know, that was a lot more mature than what I was expecting from you.”

“What is that supposed to mean? I’m super mature! I’m the most maturest mature person to ever… mature! Also I’m a girl, and everyone knows girls mature faster than boys,” she finished with a dignified huff.

Dipper rolled his eyes. “Riiight. Mabel is sooo mature. She shops for teddy bear undies in the big girl isle.”

Cheeks flushed, Mabel’s hands shot down (relative to her perspective) to cover her sweater over her unmentionables. “You saw nothing!”

“Yeah, yeah,” Dipper said with a dismissive wave. “You and your… wait a minute.” He stopped flipping through pages and brought the book up to his face. “I found it! The section on vampires.”

“Show me!” Mabel tried to stand, but only managed to flip onto her face with a thud. “Ow. Ugh. Just read it to me.”

“Huh. Well I’ll be. It says here that vampires do sometimes use a super sunblock.”

“Ah ha!” Mabel shot a fist up in triumph.

“Buuut,” Dipper continued, “it’s made of ingredients considered repugnant by vampires. If a vampire were actually using the stuff, they’d also have to wear nose plugs so they don’t gag.”

Mabel’s arm fell limp. “Ah poo.” Once she grew bored of lying on the floor, Mabel sat up and walked across the room to the side of Dipper’s regular sized bed and planted her chin on the sheets. She looked down at him with curious and thoughtful eyes.

“Mabel,” Dipper said warily as the big face loomed over him. “What’s that look for?”

“Oh nothing. Just thinking how lucky I am to have a little,” she snickered, “brother like you.”

“Oh ha-ha.”

“I mean it. You’re so tiny, but you still came after me even when you thought I was about to be eaten by a zombie. You also drove a golf cart like a total pro. How’d you do that again?”

“Specially modified for minizora drivers,” Dipper explained, trying to focus on his reading. Now that he’d started, there were just so many interesting factoids about vampires he’d never considered before. “Besides, you’d have done the same for me.”

“Well duh! But that’s different. You were in, like, way more danger than me back there. What if one of those creepy gnomes stepped on you?”

“I’ve been stepped on before. Not that big a deal,” Dipper explained dismissively. “Also, I wasn’t the target for what I assume to have been an attempted gang bang by said creepy gnomes.”

Mabel pouted cutely. “You’re making it really hard to give a heartfelt thank you for saving my life, you know. You put your life on the line for me when you didn’t have to, and that means a lot.”

Dipper finally closed the book. “Actually, I did have to.”

“Huh?”

“It’s like when someone’s driving and a rabbit runs out in the middle of the road. Technically they don’t have to slow down and let the fluffy adorable critters live, but if they don’t slow down, then they just end up feeling awful all day. I wasn’t about to spend the rest of the summer feeling awful about myself, so there really wasn’t a choice.”

Eyes shimmering, Mabel shot out a giant hand and snatched up her diminutive brother and pressed him firmly against her cheek in her closest approximation of a hug. “I love you Dipper. You’re the best brother ever! I don’t ever want to let you go.”

Then there came a tapping from the floor.

“Hey, keep it down up there!” groused the gruff voice of their Grunkle Stan. “I don’t need to hear what a couple of preteens are doing so late at night alone in their room.”

“Ugh, gross!” growled Mabel as she stomped the floor in retaliation.

Dipper began to laugh as Mabel continued to hold him. “You’re not a half bad sister, either.”

“Watch it, bro-bro.” Suddenly serious, Mabel pointed an accusing finger at Dipper. “If you make me mad, then I’ll show you just how immature I can really be.”

“Oh really?” Dipper asked in taunting. “Well that would certainly be a change of pace.” Even as Mabel fumed, Dipper couldn’t help himself and laughed at her expense. As her brother, he had a moral imperative to tease her at every opportunity, regardless of the consequences.

“Fine! If you like my teddy bear panties so much, then maybe you’d like to get acquainted for the rest of the night,” she warned, giving him a chance to back down.

Dipper’s eyebrow climbed up his forehead. “You realize that’d just prove Grunkle Stan right, don’t you?”

Ire gone, Mabel blinked like a deer caught in the headlights. “Shoot!” She kicked impotently at the floor. “That’s no fair. How can I be a good big sister and keep my little brother in line if I can’t use my go-to for punishment?”

Dipper rolled his eyes. “Are you actually asking, or are you just thinking out loud? Because if the latter, can I get the journal back?” He pointed back down at the bed. “I dropped it when you grabbed me.” When he caught a devious glint in his sister’s eye, Dipper knew he had to act quickly. “Keep in mind that this journal has all kinds of information regarding the dangerous secrets of this town. If it weren’t for that thing, I might not have gone after you in the first place. If anything bad happens to that book, I might not be able to save you next time.”

Mabel deflated and blew a raspberry. “Double poo.” She turned a longing eye on the mini boy in her hand. “Isn’t there anything I can do to punish you?” she pleaded pitifully.

“You’re seriously asking me that?” Were this anyone but Mabel, Dipper would be floored by the audacity of it all.

“Yeah. You’ve got some pretty good ideas sometimes. What’s something I can do to assert myself as the dominant twin that doesn’t cross the line into, you know, weirdness?”

Dipper smirked. “That’s never bothered you before. I think I’ve completed, like, half my homework while stuffed in your clothes somewhere.” He gestured up and down her body. “At this point it’s not even really a punishment. More like my second room.”

“Pleaaase!”

“Oh fine. Let me think.” Dipper tapped his chin in thought, silently cursing himself for being unable to resist his sister’s cute antics. “Hmm. I guess we could…”
1213121.title: Little Dipper

12131211.content:
After settling into this den of weirdness, Dipper and Mabel were in the Mystery Shack’s dining room having just completed an epic syrup race. Mabel had won, much to her regret, and Dipper was reading the towns’ newspaper; scaled down for minizora of course.

“Hey Mabel. Look at this.”

The bigger – but not older – sibling peered down at the tiny article. “Human sized hamster ball. Wait a minute… I’m human sized!” She sucked in a shocked breath. “And so are you! But with a regular hamster ball. We can be hamster ball twins!”

Dipper rolled his eyes and pointed to what he actually wanted to show her. It was a contest for photos of monsters. The winner got $1000. “We see weirder stuff than that every day. Did we get any photos of those gnomes?”

“Nope. Just memories.” Mabel waited a second before holding up a tuft of white hair. “And this beard hair.”

“Why did you save that?” asked Dipper, backing away in revulsion.

Speaking of revulsion, that was when Grunkle Stan came in dressed in a pair of boxers and a night shirt with stains that were better left not thought about. The old man wanted to close the shop early and have a bonding day with the family. He promised that this would be nothing like the last time in which they made counterfeit money, which was followed up by a trip to the freezing county jail. With assurances like that, how could they refuse?

After a harrowing blindfolded drive across town, the twins were finally allowed to uncover their eyes and behold the lake, where apparently fishing season had opened. Said lake was positively lousy with the town’s colorful denizens doing all sorts of wacky antics. Watching some of the rougher antics led to Mabel grabbing Dipper and setting him on her shoulder for safe keeping. But just as Grunkle Stan was finishing his less than stellar sales pitch for fishing for the next ten hours, that’s when another old man started going off about some monster called the Gobblewonker.

“Aww,” Mabel cooed. “He’s doing a happy jig.”

That’s when old man McGucket grabbed her shoulders and started screaming. “No. It’s a jig of grave danger!” warned the guy who had earned the title of town kook. He gave a far more convincing pitch for why the gobblewonker was real, pointing a boat that looked to have been bitten in half and offering a pretty detailed description of the creature. Alas, everyone else was entirely dismissive of his claims and soon the crowd dispersed, including his own son.

“Mabel, did you hear what he said?” Dipper asked excitedly.

“Aww, donkey spittle,” she said in approximation of the old man’s funny way of talking.

“No, the other thing. The monster. If we can snag a photo, we can split the prize fifty-fifty.”

“That’s two fifties!”

“Imagine what you could do with $500,” Dipper encouraged, not bothering to correct her math. He then sat back as his sister’s pupils went wide. Clearly she’d been kidnapped by her own imagination again and it was just a matter of waiting for her to come back.

“Dipper. I am one million percent on board with this!”

Once again, Grunkle Stan delivered an inferior sales pitch for fishing, although this time he lost to Soos who’d just driven up in a far superior boat. It wasn’t a hard choice.

“We’re gonna find that gobblewonker!”

“We’re gonna win that prize!”

Once the excitement tempered a bit, the team of a pair of twins and the pair shaped chipmunk faced guy set about their plan. They’d gone and bought an excessive amount of disposable cameras, which made a lot of sense given that none of them wanted to risk their expensive phones. As the boat neared Scuttlebutt Island, an ominous fog descended upon them. The island itself was just as creepy, but spirits were still high.

“So, do you carry him around with you everywhere?” Soos asked.

Mabel shrugged. “Not everywhere. Just most wheres. Hehe. Saves him the trouble of getting lost.”

“Me, lost? You once got lost on the way to the bathroom.”

“The point is that it’s just easier this way,” Mabel insisted. “He’s like a knight riding atop his elegant and beautiful steed.”

“She’s absolutely right,” agreed Dipper. “The real steed’s at the shop for repairs, so they gave me this,” he gestured with his thumb, “cheap rental.”

“Heh. Good one, dude.”

“Cheap? I’ll have you know that I’m about to be a five hundred-naire.”

“Yeah? Well so am I.”

“I’m just happy to tag along,” Soos offered. “Speaking of tagging, I’ve never really known a minizora before. What’s it like being so small?”

“Terrible. No matter what I do, I can always look up people’s noses and see the horrors that lie within.” That got everyone chuckling. “But seriously, it’s not too bad. It doesn’t hurt that I’ve got a nice steed to take me places.”

“See. He admits I’m a steed.”

“It’s just easier than saying rented mule-ow!” Dipper groaned as his head was pinched. “Somebody help! A pair of sausage fingers are crushing my head!”

“You sure that’s safe, dude?” Soos asked.

“Oh he’s fine,” assured Mabel. “First day here that lumberjack guy stepped on him and he just walked it off. This,” she tightened her pinch, “is nothing.”

Dipper finally stopped yelling, showing that he was just putting on a show. “Yeah, she’s right. There’s a reason so many stunt men are minizora, you know. We can handle just about anything.”

“Anything?”

“Anything,” Dipper affirmed.

“How much can you bench-press?”

“I once saw him lift up a whole pizza crust.”

“Wow, dude. You’re like a super hero. Got the proportionate strength of an ant, only you’re already pretty small, so it’s not that impressive, but it’s still pretty cool.”

“Wow. Thanks a lot, Soos,” Dipper said, feeling genuinely moved. Part of why he was the bookish type was because most kids his own age just made fun of him for being small. It was a refreshing change of pace to actually hear praise.

Mabel grinned from ear-to-ear. She’d already liked Soos. They got each other’s humor. But in seeing how nice he was to Dipper, Mabel knew she’d made a new friend for life.

That’s when a roar echoed through the woods. Birds were sent cawing in terror as the team finally had a direction.

“This is it. This is it!” Dipper said in whispered excitement. Still sitting on his sister’s shoulder, he kicked at her through her sweater and urged her onward. “Ya, mule! Ya-ya, mule!”

“Dude. That’d be so offensive… if it weren’t so hilariously accurate,” commented Soos as he grabbed a long and sharp stick. Perfect for stabbing.
12131211.title: Fishing Trip

121312111.content:
Unfortunately, it all turned out to be a false alarm. What looked like the gobblewonker through the fog was really just a derelict rotted out boat covered in cute beavers. And what sounded like the gobblewonker was actually an old chainsaw engine being messed with by a beaver.

“But… I was so sure.”

“There, there, little bro,” consoled Mabel, petting his head.

“Hey. At least we got to see a beaver with a chainsaw. That’s pretty sweet.”

“Maybe that old guy was crazy after all.” Dipper slumped on his slumping seat.

“He did use the word ‘scrap-doodle’,” Mabel agreed, just as despondent. While Soos was preoccupied with the beaver, the preteen girl decided to make some distance to give her brother some ‘alone’ time; which of course meant that she stuck nearby at all times.

“This sucks. We didn’t find the gobblewonker, and what are we gonna say to Grunkle Stan? We ditched him over nothing.”

“It’s not so bad. I mean, yeah, it’s pretty bad,” agreed Mabel. “He seemed really excited just to hang out with us and we left him high and dry… in that dinky little boat.”

Then there came a rumble.

“Mabel. Did you feel-whoa!” Dipper slipped, but thankfully caught himself on Mabel’s lifejacket.

“Ahh!” Mabel screamed, pointing out into the water where something big was swimming around.

“This is it!” cheered Dipper, pulling out one of their last few cameras. “I just have to-agh. Mabel, hold still. I can’t get a good shot with you moving.”

“Uh, dude,” intoned Soos worriedly.

In the few seconds since Dipper had taken his eyes off the lake, the gobblewonker had come up to the shore, rose it’s long neck out of the water, and loomed menacingly over the trio. And then, just as Dipper turned back around, it roared.

“Ruuun!”

In complete disregard to logic, the aquatic gobblewonker flopped its mighty frame onto land and used its flippers to give chase after the trio. Dipper couldn’t run on his own, but he could stare into the jaws of death and warn the others where and when trees were falling on them. And while Soos was able to get them to the boat, the gobblewonker just hopped back in the water, where it was significantly faster. What followed was an exciting chase across the lake, overturning many boats and causing general mayhem. Grunkle Stan would have found it hilarious, were he not on the business end of it.

“Ahh! Beavers!” cried Mabel as beavers began raining down on the boat. With their home just destroyed, the little fuzz balls were understandably agitated and were biting at anything they could reach. “Ahh! My brother!” Before one of the overgrown rats could chomp the little guy, Mabel beat him to it and stuffed Dipper in her mouth for safe keeping.

This was hardly a new experience for Dipper. He’d been eaten by his sister more times than he could count, though usually it was under less life threatening circumstances. The air was humid, Mabel had apparently forgotten to brush this morning, and saliva was creeping into his clothes. Keeping her lips shut, Mabel was still screaming as Dipper bounced around on the soft tongue. In a brief respite, he caught himself thinking that this wouldn’t be so bad if only he weren’t wearing sticky clingy clothes, but that was neither here nor there.

Pulling out a flashlight, Dipper opened the journal and quickly searched for anything related to the gobblewonker, but instead found a very interesting map of the lake. He tapped at Mabel’s teeth and signaled her to open her mouth. She did, screaming as she’d taken over the steering after Soos had been incapacitated by a beaver. “Head for the waterfall!” Dipper instructed as he clung to the tongue for dear life.

Mabel did, and everyone braced themselves for the worst. Fortunately, the journal proved true. There was a cave on the other side. Even better, it was too small for the gobblewonker, rendering it stuck.

“It’s stuck!” Dipper cheered, patting himself down within his sister’s maw. “Wait, I don’t have any more cameras!” he exclaimed in a sudden panic.

“Blah.” Mabel extended her tongue with her brother upon it and removed his hat, where he still had one tiny camera left. How lucky were they to find a place that sold tiny cameras? “Zare,” she said helpfully with her tongue still occupied.

Overwhelmed with elation, Dipper danced around on the tongue as he ran through the entire roll of film. “This is it! We finally got the picture.”

“Yay!” Mabel also cheered, ignoring the taste of fabric. It was more fun to play with a naked brother in her mouth than a clothed one. This would be important information to consider for later.

However, while everyone was cheering, the gobblewonker’s flailing caused a light cave in, leading to a large rock crushing its head and making some odd metallic sounds.

“What the?” Mabel started to ask. “Ahh, Dipper!” She reached out, but the little guy was already hopping down the cliff with the speed of a goat.

“Wow. Quick little dude, ain’t he,” observed Soos.

“You have no idea,” Mabel grumbled irritably. She hated when Dipper ran away from her, especially towards something so obviously dangerous. Her own efforts to follow were slower and more careful. Oh, Dipper was going to pay for making her worry like this.

“Hey guys, come check this out,” Dipper called from atop the creatures back.

Once they’d arrived, they found one of those spinning door cranks. It was on Mabel and Soos to open it up, revealing…

“Old man McGucket!”

The town kook was at some kind of control panel. It was defunct now, but clearly he’d been piloting the gobblewonker. As it turned out, he’d built this behemoth killing machine because he felt neglected and wanted some attention, especially from his family. While even he admitted that it was pretty contrived, his story did move the kids to sympathy for their own old person.

In the end, they all decided to make up with and spend the rest of the day with their favorite Grunkle. Fishing turned out to be a lot of fun. Even fleeing the lake police was enjoyable. All was well, except that there was an old man in a cave with a history of building death machines and the stated intent of making a death ray. Not to mention that Dipper never finished reading the lake segment of the journal, which had a good many pages devoted to the real life gobblewonker.

With the sun set and the day concluded, the Pines family and Soos departed the lake for their respective homes. Mabel held Dipper in her lap all the while, wondering how she was going to deal with her brother’s reckless behavior.
121312111.title: Gobblewonker

1213121111.content:
Following dinner at the Mystery Shack, Dipper and Mabel decided to wash up before heading to bed; especially Dipper who was all too eager to discard his saliva drenched clothes.

“Hey Mabel, could you get a cup of water or something?” asked the naked twelve year old of his undressing twin sister.

“Huh?” Standing in the bathroom, Mabel was down to just a pair of blue panties. She stared at her tiny naked brother, free of any sense of shame. They’d been bathing together since they were born, so the sight of the other’s naked body was nothing new to either of them.

“It’s just I don’t want these,” Dipper gestured to the clothes in his arms, “to dry and get all crusty before they can get washed. You know what crusty clothes are like.”

“Ugh! Only cuz you won’t shut up about it,” grumbled Mabel as she picked up the pile of garments and reached over the sink to ready a glass of water. This brought her bare and underdeveloped chest awfully close to her brother, but Dipper’s eyes were on something more important than her little nubs.

“Is something wrong, Mabel?”

“What? No. Of course not!” She kicked at the carpet. “Why would you think something’s wrong?”

Dipper cringed. “Oh, you know, no reason. Just being a concerned brother is all.”

“Concerned brother, huh? Is that what you call it when you leave me behind and run straight towards a giant monster?”

“Hey, give me a break. I was curious.”

“Curious, huh? Curiosity killed the cat, Dipper!” she said like it was some scathing accusation.

“In my defense, a giant rock just fell on the thing’s head. It was either dead or concussed. Either way, I’m too small to be looked at as prey. I was perfectly safe.”

“There’s nothing safe about giant sea monsters, little Dipper. You could have been hurt. Do you have any idea how worried I was?”

Dipper was taken aback when he caught his sister sniffling. Her eyes glistened before she turned her back on him. He reached out for her. “Mabel…”

“I’m taking a shower,” she huffed, slipping off her panties and discarding them to the side. Her immense hair shielded the back of her body as she marched off to the tub.

With a defeated sigh, Dipper turned back to the sink. He’d have preferred to shower with his sister like usual, but there were accommodations in the nozzles for a minizora to handle, so at least he could pour himself a steamy bath. The little boy dove in like it was a pool and swam around idly. Every now and then he’d turn to the silhouette of his sister in the shower, but she said nothing. She wasn’t even singing the latest awful boyband hit, but the only thing more awful than that was the ongoing silence.

“Um, Mabel,” Dipper called, but got no answer. He heaved a sigh. “Look Mabel, I’m sorry I made you worry, but I don’t think you’re being very fair right now. We were both in danger you know. How do you think I felt with everyone running for their lives and me being able to do nothing to help?”

Finally Mabel tossed the shower curtain aside and turned the water off. “That’s not your job, Dipper. I’m the big sister, so that means I-”

“There, right there!” Dipper accused. “That’s what’s not fair. We’re twins, but you’re always putting it on yourself to protect me even though I’m just as worried about you.”

“That’s not the same.”

“Except it is. That whole gnome debacle could have been avoided if you’d just listened to me from the start. I tried letting you do things on your own, and look where that got us.”

Mabel scoffed in disbelief. “So what? You want to be the big sibling and look after me from now on? Ha! I’d like to see that.”

Dipper rolled his eyes. “I’m trying to say that it’s unfair of you to think you’re the only one that gets worried. You’re my sister and I want to see you safe, but I still let you go out and make your own mistakes. I don’t smother you.”

Mabel blinked. Dripping naked, she stepped out of the shower and over to the sink. “Is that how you feel about me?”

Feeling sheepish, Dipper grabbed his arm and averted his gaze. “Sometimes.”

“Well… I guess it was kind of unfair of me to forget that you get just as worried as I do,” Mabel conceded. “And maaaybe I overreacted just a tad this time with the gobblewonker.”

“Not during the attack, though. Only after,” Dipper corrected. “When that thing was after us, you actually listened to me. You trusted me to make the right call and that’s what pulled us through.” He reached out and motioned for Mabel to come down to his level. She did, lowering her chin to the counter and extending a hand; whichever he’d prefer.

Dipper went for Mabel’s cheek and gave it an affectionate pat. “All I’m asking is that you trust me a bit more. Trust me like I trust you.”

Mabel sniffled and stroked a finger down Dipper’s back. “I’m still going to be worried about you, though.”

“Like I could stop you,” chuckled Dipper. “Hey, you forgot to tell Soos the whole story with the lumberjack guy. You know, where you started attacking him like you had rabies or something.”

Mabel giggled. “Hey, I was just trying to teach him a lesson about watching his step.”

“Animal control was called and the guy’s shoes were ruined,” Dipper deadpanned.

Mabel sighed fondly. “Yeah. I think I hate the taste of shoes.”

“Everyone does, Mabel. But you’re one of the few people who takes the time to make sure.”

Humming contentedly, Mabel picked her little brother up and carried him to the shower. “Want to join me?” she asked while stepping back in.

“Sure thing.” Though Dipper just expected their typical mutual wash, his sister had something else in mind as she casually tossed him in her mouth.

“Ooh yesh,” Mabel said through her mouthful. Naked Dipper was so much better than clothed Dipper. She couldn’t quite put a name on his flavor. She’d licked skin before, her own and that of others, but in those cases it had been tasteless at best and gag inducing at normal. But with Dipper, there was just some intangible quality that made him absolutely delicious. She was content to just chalk it up to being another minizora thing and leave it at that, but for right now she had the more pressing priority of running her tongue over every square inch of his body.

Mabel licked over Dipper’s face, feeling him smile. She licked under his armpits, which made him thrash about from being tickled. Over his butt got a similar result, but by far the most exquisite part of her brother’s body was his groin. Somehow that tiny penis and pair of balls had the strongest flavor of any part of him. And when she devoted special attention there, she giggled at how he grew erect. She loved how she could do this to him. For all their talk of trust and respect, Mabel would never relinquish the power of being the big sister.

Inside the moist maw, Dipper was moaning as he was pelted on all sides by soft flesh. When it was just his bare skin, the stickiness didn’t bother him as much. In fact, he rather enjoyed being in his sister’s mouth. He enjoyed being played with, of being tossed around and toyed with. Mabel knew all the right ways to touch him that just felt so incredible. And now that she was focusing on his penis, the little boy cried out in rapture as he bucked his hips into the slimy organ.

Mabel continued her affectionate tongue bath until she’d achieved her reward. A tiny but potent sprits of sweet and sour flavoring. It was the perfect dessert after a long day of monster hunting, a treasure that was hers alone to enjoy. She hummed, continuing to toss her brother around her mouth until finally that extra special flavor disappeared and she spat him back out. “Have fun?” she beamed, already knowing the answer.

Panting from his ordeal in Mabel’s hands, Dipper looked up and gave a weak-armed thumbs up. This was their way of saying that all was forgiven. From there they got cleaned up properly, dressed for the night, and went to bed. All was as it should be, with not a care in the world devoted to the old man and his death ray, nor the mysterious triangular constellation that briefly appeared in the night’s sky.
1213121111.title: Twin Confrontation

12131211111.content:
In the TV room, Dipper sat on his sister’s shoulder while they ate popcorn and watched the latest episode of Ducktective.

“That duck is a genius,” awed Mabel as she went through the motions of giving a single corn to her shoulder occupant.

Dipper shrugged, unimpressed. “Eh. It’s easier to find clues when you’re that close to the ground.”

“Speaking from experience?” teased Mabel as she poked him in the gut. “Like you could actually outwit Ducktective.”

“I’ll have you know that I have very keen powers of observation,” Dipper boasted. “For example: Just from smelling your breath, I know that you’ve been eating… an entire tube of toothpaste?”

“It was so sparkly,” Mabel confessed, sounding just a bit sick.

“Hey dudes. You’ll never guess what I just found!” declared Soos.

“Bur-” Dipper was silenced by a finger over his mouth.

“Buried treasure!” exclaimed Mabel. “Ha. I win.”

As it turned out, the ‘buried treasure’ was a secret door hidden behind the wallpaper. Within was a room filled with wax dummies of various historical figures. Grunkle Stan told the story of how he’d ‘purchased’ the figures years ago, but then locked them in here after the wax museum stopped being profitable, and also he’d just forgotten about them. When it was discovered that wax Abraham Lincoln had melted, Mabel had jumped at the chance to remake it into something new. When being offered free labor to resurrect an old and potentially profitable attraction, Stan was all too happy to oblige.

Later that day, Dipper was enjoying a rare instance of independence without being carried around by Mabel. It felt good to stretch his legs and do little things like get his own soda. Walking down the hall, he was enjoying a few sips when Mabel sprung out of nowhere, causing him to drop his drink.

“Dipper, I have to show you my ideas.” She held up a sketchbook. “She’s part fairy princess, and part horse fairy princess,” she described of the abominable centaur monstrosity.

“Mmmaybe you should carve something from real life,” Dipper suggested, not wanting to crush his sister’s artistic dreams.

It took a bit of trial and error, but eventually Mabel settled on sculpting a very special member of her family.

“Wow, dude. Your sister’s, like, really good at this,” Soos commented from the doorway.

“Yeah. Once she gets in one of these artsy moods, basically nothing can stop her.” Then Dipper got an idea. “Hey, Soos. I’ll pay you five bucks to go in there and tell her to stop.”

Soos glowered down at the little dude. “Dude, I’m no Albert Einstein, but I’m not stupid. I heard the full story of what happened to Manly Dan and there ain’t no way I’m sticking my hand in a fish tank filled with piranha.”

Dipper chuckled. “Yeah, fair point.”

Later still, there was a big ceremony for the reopening of the wax museum. At the ticket booth, Dipper sat alongside Wendy. She was the fifteen year old ginger who worked the Shack’s counter most days. Her body was leanly built with well-defined muscle, a modest chest for her age, and a rump that was nothing to scoff at. She had a fondness for flannel shirts and wore a fur hat.

Dipper was pretending not to notice the afore mentioned details as he sat in a tiny chair on the table. Technically his job was to guard the money jar, but he had the feeling that he was actually being used as just another oddity to attract customers. “I can’t believe how many people showed up for this. It looks like half the town is here.”

“I know, right,” agreed Wendy in her usual laidback demeanor. She was also pretending not to notice Dipper. She’d never seen a minizora before and there was something about this little cutie that kept drawing her eye. “Folks around here must be super bored. Either that or Stan bribed them.”

Dipper unfurled a green bill from his jacket. “He bribed me.” Wendy pulled out her own bill and they shared a laugh. This was nice. Aside from his mother and sister, Dipper had never really hung out with a girl before, especially not one this pretty. It wasn’t weird that he thought she was pretty, right?

When the unveiling finally got underway, it was tragically met with a lukewarm response from the audience. Fortunately, Mabel was not so easily deterred. “Thank you all for coming. I made this sculpture with my own two hands. It’s covered in my blood, sweat, tears, and other fluids.”

While the rest of the audience gagged at the implications, Wendy stole a wary glance at Dipper. Reluctantly, the minizora nodded that this was the case, to which Wendy commented, “Hehe, gross.”

“I will now take questions!” Mabel announced.

“Old man McGucket. Local kook,” he introduced himself. “Are the wax figures alive and – follow-up question – can I survive the wax man uprising?”

“Um… yes! Next question.”

A few more questions followed before Shandra Jimenez spoke up. In this one horse town, she was considered the only ‘real’ reporter. She was Hispanic with dark skin, high cheek bones, and one of the finest bodies in all of Gravity Falls. “Your flyer promised free pizza with admission to this event. Is this true?” Despite her dispassionate tone, this questions seemed to wake the audience up as everyone was up in arms. Literally. Some people had actually brought pickaxes and pitchforks to a wax museum opening.

“This probably isn’t good,” Wendy observed, bracing herself to run. She then remembered her table companion and suddenly felt awkward. Was it okay to pick up a minizora without asking, even in an emergency?

Sure enough, Stan dismissed what had apparently been the primary interest of the audience and attempted to flee with the money. This in turn led to a small riot in which chairs were thrown and poles were punched. Wendy, ever a girl of action, snatched Dipper off the table, stowed him in her breast pocket, and ferried him out of the danger zone.

Dipper wasn’t too worried about his predicament. He’d been picked up by strangers before, but Wendy wasn’t exactly a stranger. She’d never been overtly hostile and generally treated him with better courtesy than she did most patrons of the Shack. The inside of her breast pocket was hot and the fabric was a little itchy. It also smelled. Dipper knew that there was only one thing he could be smelling at this time and wasn’t sure how he felt about it.

“Hey! No punching the banner poles!” Mabel snapped, pointing at Manly Dan the lumberjack. As soon as the pair’s eye’s met, the man who resembled a shaved red yeti decided to be anywhere but near that sack of adorable crazy. Once the audience dispersed, Mabel casually walked over to Wendy and with her eternal cheerfulness, held out her hand in a gi-me gesture. Wendy obliged and surrendered the tiny twin. “I think that went well,” Mabel commented.

“Actually, yeah,” agreed Wendy. “Compared to how these things usually go, there’s almost no damage. Oh, and sorry little dude,” she said to Dipper. “For picking you up without asking, I mean. It was kind of a spur of the moment thing.”

“Oh hey,” Dipper laughed nervously. “It was no big deal.”

“Not big, but adequate sized,” Mabel commented to the confusion of the others. “You acted quick and decisive, prioritizing safety over personal autonomy. And for that, you have my respect.” She extended her other hand, which Wendy happily shook.

“Wow. That’s… unsettlingly authoritarian, but whatever.” The red head shrugged. “I just didn’t want the little guy hurt is all. Oh well.” She set her hands on her hips and surveyed the mess. “Looks like a lot of work to do. Think I’ll clock out early.” And she beat a lazy retreat.

Mabel grinned as she watched the taller girl go. “I like her.”
12131211111.title: Headhunters

121312111111.content:
Later that night, Dipper and Mabel were upstairs brushing their teeth. Mabel had just suggested a tooth brush race when they heard the cries of horror from downstairs. Being a couple of twelve year olds who’d already faced down two horrifying monsters in less than a week, they decided to run towards the sound of danger. That’s where they found the source of the commotion. Wax Stan had been murdered via decapitation and his head was nowhere to be found. It was so gruesome that Mabel fainted; (accidentally) crushing Dipper under her butt.

The police arrived in short order, given that this was probably the biggest criminal activity they’d seen in weeks. Even so, the sheriff seemed reluctant to even do minimal investigation, so Dipper volunteered.

“Thank you Dipper,” squeed Mabel, hugging him to her cheek. “I knew I could count on you.”

“Oh, well would you look at what we got in here,” taunted Sheriff Blubs. “City boy gonna solve the mystery with his fancy computer phone.”

“City boooy!” called the deputy. “City boooy!”

“You are adorable,” Blubs added, leading the both of them to laugh.

“Adorable?” Dipper asked. He’d been called a lot of names over his life and had learned to shrug off most of them, but for some reason this one really dug under his skin. When the cops left, Dipper was filled with righteous indignation. “That’s it! Mabel, you and me are going to find out who did this and get back that head. Then they’ll see who’s adorable,” he snarled, trying to look as tough as possible. Then he sneezed.

“Aww. You sneeze like a kitten,” Mabel cooed, finding his wrathful glare all the more endearing.

The next morning, the investigation was underway. The twins were taking photos for evidence, compiling a list of suspects, and consulting the journal for anything supernatural that might be related. Yet it was Mabel who found the first clue in the form of shoeprints in the shag carpeting.

“Dang. How did I miss that?” Dipper grumbled. “So much for being closer to the ground.”

“Some things you can only see from high up,” Mabel explained.

“Whatever. The point is that these shoeprints have a hole in the left shoe. That’s pretty unusual. And they lead to…” An axe was found just behind the chair. Dipper just glowered at the axe for a solid few seconds. “We’ve been here literally five minutes and already found the murder weapon, but a couple of ‘professional’ cops didn’t do jack,” Dipper ranted.

“Hey, maybe they were tired,” Mabel excused. “Or, you know, I hear towns like these include playing FPS games as part of their police exams.”

Dipper frowned. “Now it feels like I’m racing against someone without arms or legs.” He then slapped himself for daring to pity the enemy. “Doesn’t matter. We’ve still got a mystery to solve!”

After conversing with Soos, the axe was connected to Manly Dan, who frequented an intense biker joint downtown. Soos also tried coining the term ‘mystery twins’, but Dipper was in no mood for cute names. Grunkle Stan, upon seeing the kids with an axe and plans on confronting the possible murderer, cheered them on to “Avenge meee!”

Dipper was suffering an increasingly low opinion of the town’s collective IQ after Mabel’s fake IDs actually got them into the bar. Inside there were all manner of ruffians punching one another for no discernable reason. Still the picture of perkiness, Mabel deposited Dipper in her sweater collar and attempted to hold him close. However, much to her consternation, he wiggled free.

“Come on, Mabel. We talked about this already.”

“Now? You want to go off and do your own thing here of all places?” When Dipper just crossed his arms and impatiently tapped his foot, Mabel gave a conceding groan. “Okay, fine. But if you get stepped or sat on, that’s on you.” And they split up. Dipper went straight for Manly Dan while Mabel decided to destress by chatting up a very tattooed and burly man.

“Manly Dan, just the guy I wanted to see,” Dipper greeted, trying to look tough as he stood on the arm wrestling machine Dan was playing. “Where were you last night?”

“Punching the clock,” growled the lumberjack, sounding like he was perpetually on the verge of going into a blood rage.

“You were at work?”

“No, I was punching that clock.” He pointed out the window to a clock atop a crooked post. “It offended me with its incessant ticking.”

“Ten o’ clock, the time of the murder,” Dipper mumbled. He then regretted not bringing Mabel along as he dragged the axe over for inspection. “So I guess you’ve never seen this before?”

“Listen here, little girl,” Dan barked.

“Uh, actually-”

“I wouldn’t pick my teeth with that axe. It’s left handed. I only use my right hand.” He demonstrated this by ripping the arm off of the machine. “The MANLY hand!”

As Manly Dan proceeded to beat the snot out of what remained of the machine, Dipper backed away, feeling that he’d been sufficiently emasculated for one day. He caught up with Mabel doing some weird school yard fortune telling thing and gave her the update. They just had to run through the list of suspects and see who was left handed.

Unfortunately, that proved easier said than done. One montage later and it turned out that there wasn’t a single leftie in the whole town. Even when the twins thought they’d cornered someone, they learned far more than they ever wanted about Toby Determined. They did get an extra clue that the axe had no prints at all, but that just deepened the mystery. Worse, the cops laughed at them.

Defeated, the twins returned to the Mystery Shack to attend the funeral of Wax Stan. It was a tasteful ceremony held in the wax figures’ old room with all of their lifeless forms in attendance. To Soos and Stan it looked like the twins were down about the murder, but they were mourning another loss as the adults left the room.

“Those cops were right about me,” Dipper grumbled in Mabel’s lap.

“Come on, Dipper,” Mabel encouraged, petting Dipper with one hand and holding the axe in another. “We’ve come so far. We can’t give up now.”

Dipper sighed, hopped down to the floor, and headed for the casket. “But I considered everything. The weapon, the motive, the clues…” He climbed up to get one last look at the dearly departed, where he noticed something odd. “Hmm. Wax Stan’s shoe has a hole in it.”

“All the wax guys have that,” Mabel explained plainly. “It’s where the pole thingy attaches to their stand dealies.”

“What has holes in its shoes and no finger prints?” It didn’t take much before Dipper’s eyes went wide and his pulse quickened. “Uh, Mabel!” he whispered in alarm. “I think the murderers are-”
121312111111.title: Wax Murder

1213121111111.content:
“Standing right behind you,” finished Wax Sherlock Holmes as he and the other wax figures all came to life.

“Oh-my-gosh-oh-my-gosh-oh-my-gosh,” Mabel panicked as the axe was ripped from her fingers by Wax Lizzie Borden, the infamous axe murderer. Naturally, Mabel responded by immediately pulling her brother close for safety.

“Congratulations my two amateur sleuths. You uncovered the truth,” patronized the detective. “And now we’re going to bury you.” He pointed his magnifying glass like a weapon.

“But… how is this possible? You’re made of wax,” asserted Dipper in disbelief.

“Are you… magic?” asked Mabel, giving in to her girlish wonder.

“Magic. She wants to know if we’re magic?” mocked Wax Sherlock before slamming his fist on the casket. “We’re cursed!”

“Cursed!” echoed the other figures.

“Cursed to come to life whenever the moon is waxing.”

“Uh, sorry to interrupt, but that doesn’t sound like a curse,” Dipper piped up. “Curses have more of a negative implication. Like if you were the real guys who were turned into wax. That’d be a curse.”

“Yeah,” agreed Mabel. “Being able to come to life sounds like a blessing.”

Wax Sherlock, unable to think up a counterargument, decided to tell their backstory. After they were stolen from their previous owner, they were set up here for the wax museum. By day they were overpriced attractions, but at night they were free to do as they pleased. It was a pleasant life, all things considered, right up until the money stopped coming in and they were locked in here.

“Can I just say one more thing?” asked Dipper.

“Oh fine. Go ahead,” allowed an annoyed Wax Sherlock.

The minizora pointed at Wax Lizzie. “You have an axe. If you didn’t like being locked up, you could have just broken out at any night.”

“And go where, hmm? You want us to be caught out in the sunlight just like Wax Lincoln?”

“I’m also not seeing how the wax museum stopped making money,” Mabel added. “I mean, it doesn’t take much to maintain you guys. Stan would have just had to do a minimal cleaning, like, once a week, which isn’t that expensive. You’ve been locked up for years and you all look in pretty good shape.”

“Thank you,” said Wax Shakespeare.

“I just… I really don’t see why you guys would be locked up in the first place. At the very least you’d be making enough money to cover the cost of cleaning.”

Wax Sherlock snorted. “That’s because your uncle is a big fat jerk.”

“Granted,” allowed Dipper. “Hold on. You guys ever see Night at the Museum?”

“I loved that movie,” gushed Mabel. “Robin Williams makes everything good.”

“It’s this movie about museum exhibits that also come to life at night,” Dipper explained to the intrigue of the figures. “The museum was about to be shut down, so they solved the problem by the end by opening the museum to night guests. That way it’s like there’s a big animatronic t-rex skeleton in the front lobby and a Wax Teddy Roosevelt who can talk with people about the real Roosevelt’s life.”

Pipe in one hand and Wax Stan’s head in the other, Sherlock’s brow made a climb up his forehead. “What are you getting at?”

“Maybe you guys could do the same. Show Grunkle Stan that you’re really alive. We can basically employ you guys and extend the Shack’s open hours.”

“Hey, yeah!” cheered Mabel. “You can be the evening crew. Give tours, talk about yourselves, and jack up prices.”

“So you guys would be able to walk free at night, and the Mystery Shack would make more money. Everyone wins.”

“Uh, hold that thought.” Sherlock motioned for the other wax figures to all gather at the far end of the room while they discussed this alternative.

“Do you think they’ll buy it?” Mabel whispered through a forced grin.

“No clue, but try scooching closer to the fire,” urged Dipper. “Their wax, so we can just melt them if things get bad.”

“Good idea.” And she discretely shuffled her way over to the fireplace to await the figures’ verdict.

1. They refuse and things go mostly like in the episode.
2. They agree and become integrated into the Shack
1213121111111.title: Wax Man Uprising

12131211111111.content:
The wax conference concluded as the figures approached the twins. “Sorry kids, but no dice. We’ve been waiting ten years to get our revenge,” he flipped the Wax Stan head around in his hand, “and next time we won’t miss.”

“So you were trying to murder Grunkle Stan for real?” asked Dipper in alarm.

“Enough, you little pipsqueaks! Now that you know our secret. You must die!”

“You first!” Mabel then wielded a fire poker like a javelin, hurling it at Wax John Wilks Booth’s head and spearing it to the wall. “Haha, got’ch’ya!” Her cheer was short lived when the body kept moving and the remaining wax figures just looked peeved. “Oops.”

“The candles!” Dipper pointed over to where Grunkle Stan had set up a refreshment table, including a pair of electric candles. Mabel wielded hers like a sword easily enough. Dipper, through much effort, wielded his like a human trying to manage an artillery cannon without wheels. “Get back or we’ll melt you into candles!”

“Decorative candles,” Mabel added threateningly.

The wax figures were intimidated at first, but then they remembered that they had the advantage in both size and numbers. “You really think you can defeat us?”

“Eh. Worth a shot.”

“So be it. Attack!”

The first casualty of the battle was Dipper’s footing as the weight of the candle threw him off balance and he fell to the floor. When Mabel turned to retrieve him, she accidentally severed Shakespeare’s arms. Dipper recovered to find the wax figures closing in on Mabel from all sides, clearly judging her to be the bigger threat.

“Never underestimate the little guy,” Dipper muttered before rolling his candle with all due haste, melting a good many feet all the way up to the ankle. In one case, Wax Robin Hood tripped and knocked Wax Larry King over, who then fell neck first onto the candle and was subsequently decapitated. “Ha! Interview that, Larry King! You alright Mabel?” He turned to his sister, and were they not in mortal danger, he would have burst out laughing.

Mabel was using the severed Coolio’s head like a mace, swinging it by the hair to bludgeon the other figures, knocking them back while she retrieved her candle. With her primary weapon retrieved, the little girl made a lunge for Wax Lizzie, but came up short and only tore her dress open. The adrenaline evaporated almost instantly as everyone paused to gawk. “Uh… wow.”

Wax Lizzie’s hands shot down to cover her exposed groin. “Don’t look!”

“I mean… damn. I knew shaving down there was kind of a more recent thing but… wow. You’d need a freaking lawnmower to trim that bush.”

“Sh-shut up!” cried the wax woman.

“I’m more concerned that someone took the time to sculpt her that way,” commented Dipper. “All these other guys have their clothes as part of their bodies, but her…” He gestured. “Someone sculpted her to not only go commando, but also have a bush big enough to hide a whole person. Someone fetishized an axe murderer!”

As the other wax figures began snickering at Lizzie’s plight, her cheeks began to burn from embarrassment. They burned so hot that she ended up melting herself. Once everyone got the giggles out of their system, the fight resumed.

Wax Sherlock finally did something smart by tossing the Stan head aside and grabbing a real sword off the wall. Dipper’s candle was smashed in short order. In response, Mabel found a broken sliver of metal near the fire place and threw it to Dipper.

“Catch!”

It was hot on both ends, but not enough to harm minizora skin. “Uh, thanks, but how do I fight a sword with a toothpick?”

“Figure it out,” Mabel urged, once more being swarmed by the remaining figures. “Die Nixon!”

With Wax Sherlock in pursuit, Dipper could only avoid and evade his strikes. Thankfully he had a lifetime of experience to help him through, but he was ever on the retreat. He knew there was only one chance. The minizora dove out the window and began ascending the Mystery Shack’s roof, once more demonstrating the climbing skills of a mountain goat.

“You think you can outwit me, boy? I’m Sherlock-bleeding-Holmes! Have you seen my magnifying glass? It’s enormous,” ranted the wax man as he haphazardly swung his sword around and dislodged the big S from the sign. Eventually he cornered Dipper, pinning him to the shingled roof with his shoe. Wax Sherlock tried increasing the pressure to crush the boy like a bug, but the minizora only laughed.

“That the best you got?” he wheezed.

“Grr. So be it.” Wax Sherlock raised his sword high. “Any last words?”

“Yeah, actually. Got any sunblock?”

“Got any-?” Wax Sherlock was cut off by the drip-drop of wax dripping onto his nose. His hands were liquefying and he lost his grip on the sword. He then turned and beheld the golden glow of the sun peeking over the forested horizon. “… no.”

“Letting me lead you to the roof? Yeah, probably not your sharpest decision,” Dipper taunted.

“Outsmarted by a child in short pants, and a minizora at that. Nooo!”

Any second thoughts Dipper might have had for killing a person were rendered null at that moment. “Sucks to be you, buddy. All my life guys like you have been looking down on me. But in just another minute, I’ll be looking down on you!”

Sure enough, with each passing second, Wax Sherlock lost more and more height, along with facial features. And really, my life is pretty great, all things considered.

“I’ve got loving parents, ten awesome sisters, and pets that actually don’t want to chew on me. Then there are my clothes, a private TV, game station, comics, and pretty much all the essentials of life at a miniature size. I even have a private bathroom, though it’s more like a tiny porta-potty that needs to be emptied once a week. Really, I’m pretty lucky. Granted, being so small, I’m pretty dependent on my sisters for a lot of stuff. I’m basically not allowed to go anywhere outside the house unless one of them is carrying me. Rachel, age 15. Land Emberdan. Emberdan is a Medieval style kingdom, complete with stone castle, a peasant village and surrounding farm land. In her diverse batch of 256, Rachel is the only child. She has scarlet hair, brown eyes, is small for her age, and a budding chest. Another distinguishing factor about little Rachel is that while her fellow Residents are strewn across the town houses and halls of the castle, wearing attire appropriate to their location, she awakes most uncomfortably on the throne, wearing robes that match her scarlet hair and a jeweled crown on her head. Can she make a decent queen for her land, and more importantly does she want to?
         Cornelius, age 21. Land: Vane. He has Awoken in what seems to be a batch of 30 within a 1930s style bunker. These 30 seem to be divided into groups of 3 according to their clothing and ethnicity. Each group sports a military uniform from a different place and time, complete with era appropriate gear, weapons, and a face and attitude to match. These soldiers include Medieval Knights, Cornelius within the British Red Coats, Japanese Samuri, Roman Legionnaires, and the 3 women are United States Marines. Though the bunker seems more than well stocked, the land outside is unmistakably a battlefield, and something is out there.
145.title: Queen To Be, Or a Guy in a Trench

1452.content:
Since you have chosen Cornelius, feel free to fill in the remaining 5 groups with whatever types you wish, or if the group seems too large then just edit them out.
         If you choose to keep the 5 extra groups, try to make them reasonably diverse. My original concepts for the other groups were Chinese Boxers, Persian Immortals, Assyrian Bow Men, Incan Bola Throwers, Zulu Iklwa Warriors
1452.title: Cornelius, The Guy In The Trench

1453.content:
Keera, age 24. Land: Obnase. Awaking in a batch of one, a brown haired Asian girl has found herself on a small blanket in the center of a grass hut. It has been 30 years since the last Awakening and the once peaceful tribes of this land have erupted into civil war. No one knows who fired the first arrow. The only thing for certain is that Keera has appeared exactly on the 30th anniversary of the previous Awakening. Keera is the only one of her ethnicity in a fairly homogenous (South American) society.
         Megan, age 26. Land: Baldram. She has wide hips, blue eyes, brown hair, but what makes her stand out most is her height. She’s just south of 9ft tall and has a killer figure. To the best of her knowledge, her only other associates are a normal sized 16 year old boy and a normal sized 17 year old girl, whom she loves very much. They live together in a luxury cabin in the middle of a tropical jungle with plenty of fruit, easy to catch animals, few visible predators, electricity, and all the time in the world to spend with one another. Further, Megan has other notable traits besides her height.
1453.title: Asian Or Amazon

14532.content:
Primary Objective: Ensure that no one is killed by local predators. Survive for 2 years.
Secondary Objective: Discover the true cause of Megan’s problems.
Bonus: Stop the predators once and for all.

Do we begin at the beginning, or 6 months later.
14532.title: Super Hot Amazon Named Megan

145321.content:
The forest was alive with noon songs. The insects chirped and birds tweeted from the tops of the rustling trees. The last remnants of the morning dew fell from the tips of leaves down to the forest floor. The grass shook as animals of all shapes and sizes stalked, scurried, and foraged. The gentle lapping of a nearby stream flowed into a nearby pond filled with the croaking of rainbow frogs. Even the fish of the stream released bubbles from their lips as if to add to the chorus of the forest’s ode to life.
         The great, golden sun shined its rays upon a grateful figure who welcomed the warmth. The figure also welcomed the rays’ revealing qualities as they showed a still distortion in the tall grass. The contorted shape of a moderately sized being lay upon the forest floor.
         As the mysterious figure approached with the utmost stealth, not wanting to alert any unwelcome predators, the large figure took the time to examine the person in the grass. The being appeared to be in its late teens and just over five feet tall. An exact measurement was difficult due to it being contorted in a fetal position. The being had short brown hair, a well toned figure, and a limp extremity hanging from between its legs.
         The mysterious figure might have continued to examine the boy, were it not for his stirrings. Gently swinging his arm over, the boy narrowly avoided contact with the mysterious figure, which cautiously pulled back. As the boy tossed it’s head from side to side, the mysterious figure knew that he was waking up. It knew it had to act quickly to avoid being seen.
         Will it be seen?
145321.title: The Beginning

choices: They flee the unknown intruders and head north into the swamp.
They go south seeking refuge in the city only to be hunted.
145322.content:
Megan stared across the table and smiled as her two guests happily ate the meal she had both caught and prepared for them. She enjoyed their company, since she had been completely alone until she found them wandering helplessly in her part of the jungle. When she found them they were without shelter during a powerful thunderstorm and looked like they haven't eaten in days, she has taken care of them ever since. They were lucky that it was her that found them and not a big cat or poisonous snake. They also happened to be in the relatively safe part of the jungle that Megan called home.

Neighboring this oasis of safety was a hostile world. To the south the jungle grows denser and is populated with predators, until the jungle suddenly stops and massive metal and glass structures climb into the sky, she knew the area was populated because the spires would light up at night from electric lights, like the ones in her home, but because of a gut feeling of dread and the alien look of the buildings she stayed away. To the north was a different matter. After a weeks journey through a inhospitable swamp the jungle was filled with an evil amazon tribe, that would kidnap any that dared enter their land, or so Megan had seen.

What she had also seen was that the hunters of the amazon tribe were only 6 feet tall at best, suggesting that Megan was the tallest person in the land at 9 feet high. Megan also saw that the amazons wore animal skins around their chests and over their pelvic areas, as opposed to herself, Kate, and Mark lacking any such fabrics to cover themselves.

In these last months she has learned much about her guests, they were both barely adults with Kate just a year older than Mark. Kate was like Megan in having dark hair and deep blue eyes, though being much smaller and standing only 5 and a half feet tall. Kate looked up to Megan wanting to be as strong and independent as the amazon and hardly left her side. Her brother, as Kate referred to him, was taller than Kate and had short black hair, though having only seen a few Amazons, the first thing Megan noticed was that Mark was unlike herself and Kate. She later concluded that there were probably other males like him in the city to the south, and that there wouldn't be any in the amazon ruled jungle, although she still couldn't figure out what males were for.

Megan stared of into space at the table, reflecting on the time the three had spent together, fishing, hunting, teaching them how to survive, and just staring up at the night sky looking at the stars. She is suddenly brought back into reality by a loud bang in the distance. Megan ran out of the cabin and onto the deck and scanned the horizon to the south. the sky was lit up with fire and columns of smoke towered into the sky. After a few moments another bang echoed through the jungle and another fire appeared, this one closer than the last. As the night went on the sound of explosions and fleeing animals filled the air, and the fires grew closer. Megan held Kate and Mark close as the two watched the inferno.

Kate looked up to Megan and in a confused voice asked, "What's going on? What's causing all this?"

"I think it's the people to the south, clearing the area to expand were going to have to leave the area it won't be safe for much longer. The only question is where should we go." Megan said as she carefully considered her options.
145322.title: Six Months Later

choices: A unnaturally large panther pounces on the group.
The group is being stalked by a humanoid in a full environmental protection sui
1453221.content:
"Garb your spears and meet me out front we need to leave before they get here." Megan said as she scanned the horizon once more before leaving the deck.

Kate grabbed her spear and ran to the front room of the cabin with Megan and waited for Mark. "So where are we going to go?" Kate asks obviously frightened by the situation.

Megan grabs Kate and pulls her close, her head barely reaching half way up Megan's chest. Megan embraced Kate tightly and comforted her. "Stay calm Kate, if you lose your nerve you won't make it far. We're going to follow the animals' lead and head north, then look for a new home after we cross the swamp. This is dangerous territory so I need you to stay strong for me."

Kate stared into Megan's deep blue eyes and was filled with hope from the confidence in the amazon's expression. " I'll be strong for you." Kate said, the fear in her voice now replaced admiration.

The two women break their embrace just as Mark enters the room. Megan motions towards the door and they take the first steeps of their long journey. Outside they are greeted by a completely different world. Smoke clouds their vision, with what little they can see tinted in a red hue from the fires. The peaceful sound of birds now replaced by the screaming and growling of animals and an metallic inhuman screech growing louder. Megan lead the group away from the fire, walking at first then frantic sprinting as the screech grew closer and closer. Moving north was difficult with no cleared path the group was forced to push through dense jungle, resulting in minor bruises and cuts on their bare skin. After clearing a few miles of rough terrain and climbing a steep hill the group turn around and and look at their former home. Near the cleared land, that the cabin was built on, the tip of a metal object could be seen above the tree line. The object slowly walked into the clearance, each step causing the earth to shake slightly. The object now stood exposed, A large spherical body held up by six large spider like legs, a portion of the sphere opened revealing a large blue crystal. The crystal glowed bright and in a flash a red beam of light appeared and scorched the earth everywhere it touched. The group watches in awe as their home is devoured by fire. They were so entranced that they failed to notice as a large figure slowly creep towards them.
1453221.title: They flee the unknown intruders and head north...

14532211.content:
As the group watched the mechanical being burn the jungle, a large black panther watched them from the shadows. Megan had unknowingly lead the group straight into the panther's territory. Unlike the other animals this predator held its ground against the advancing threat, and considered the group's trespassing an act of aggression. It moved slowly and silently until it was within striking range. Letting out a low growl the panther pounced. Megan heard the growl and turned around, and she saw the beast leaping through the air towards Mark, with little time to act Megan was able to knock Mark out of the way. Mark was now safe, however Megan was now in the panther's path. Megan hit the ground with a loud thud, as her vision focused she saw the beast's massive maw lowering towards her. Megan quickly jabs the wooden shaft of her spear on the panther's neck to keep its razor sharp teeth away.

Adrenaline pumped through Kate as she watched the powerful amazon struggle underneath the panther's weight. Kate let out a roar of primal fury and ran to Megan's aid, driving her spear into the panther's neck. The panther recoiled in pain, giving Megan an opening to kick the colossal beast off her. The panther cried out in pain before returning to its feet and darting away. Now standing in clear sight for the first time the group saw the behemoth in all it glory, standing as tall as Megan showing teeth that could easily be larger than a normal man's face. Megan picked herself up off the ground just as the panther circled around readying itself for another attack. The beast jumped through the air once more, but this time Megan was prepared, she dropped to one knee and thrust her spear forward causing the beast to impale itself. The spear drove straight through the panther's chest striking the heart and killing it immediately.

"Megan are you alright?" Mark asked as he ran to help her up.

"Yes, I'm fine thanks to Kate, she is turning into quite the amazon." Megan said while smiling at Kate.

Kate's face turns red and she averts her eyes away from Megan. "... I... just didn't want you to get hurt."

After dusting herself off, Megan once more leads the group north wanting to stay as far away from whatever the machines from the south. The next few days pass without incident, but as they reach the border of the swamplands they come across the remains of a camp site. The fire pit is cold and empty, only one tent stands, wrecked though it may be, yet marks on the ground indicate more tents once stood, the most disturbing image however is the drag marks and trail of dry blood that start from the wrecked tent.

"What happened here?" Mark asked as he raised his spear.

Megan held her spear tight and slowly followed the trail of blood. " I'm not sure just be rea...... oh my god." Megan finished. At the end of the drag marks the half eaten carcass of a man laid on the ground still rotting, tightly clenching a book in its hands.

Kate puts her hand over her mouth in disgust, but overcomes the gruesome sight and retrieves the book. "It's a diary, detailing a trip into a cave down the road." Megan said while pointing then began reading from the last entries in the book. " Day five and we're still lost, we thought this could be a safe route past the marsh of the dead, but its a damn labyrinth down here and I fear we are going in circles. Took make matters worse some of the guys are losing their grip on reality, claiming to see a monster stalking us its probably just the near black lighting playing tricks on overactive imaginations. Day six, We should leave, we should turn back and exit the way we came in, but something is drawing me in, A voice in the back of my head calling to me from the center of this maze. I'm seeing it now too and hearing a growl, It's watching us waiting for a moment to strike. I shouldn't be taking my eyes away from the shadows even to write, but I find it is the only thing that can calm my nerves. Day seven, oh god oh god, their dead all of them, I know it. It sprang from the shadows and started to rip us apart, and ... and I ran, I just left them. The only thing keeping me going is a light in the distance I must reach it. Day eight, I've made it out, I'm safe now. However it's as I feared I came out the way we entered, and whats worse I can still feel that thing's eye burning into my soul, watching me, waiting. " At this point Kate looks up with a grim look and said " This next part is written in his own blood....., It followed me out, and started to eat me alive, before leaving me to die a slow painful death. I write this now as a warning to all that may find this, if you go into it's lair it will never stop hunting you... Abandon hope all ye who enter here."

"The marsh of the dead, that's what the swamp is called! So are choices are this swamp of the dead or, from how that book describes it, the gates of hell, that's just wonderful." Mark says hysterically.

After seeing the gruesome corpse Megan wanted nothing to do with the cave, but just like the dead man, a voice in her head beckoned her to enter.
14532211.title: A unnaturally large panther pounces on the gro...

choices: A spear held by an Amazon.
145322111.content:
Megan placed her hand on Mark's shoulder and said, "Don't worry the swamp is dangerous, but it's nothing like this". Megan takes one last look at the body, before leading everyone away from the cave and towards the marshland. As they get closer to the swamp, the jungle becomes less dense until it reaches the point where the only vegetation is patches of tall grass and everything became silent after they reached the border of the swamp. Fog clouded their vision, but from what they could see showed how inhospitable the landscape was. The water was murky and near black, and it was devoid of life, with the exception of plants Megan recognized as poisonous. Megan walks into the murky water and continues forward with ease, but for Mark and Kate the water reached their waists. Mark kept his spear ready to strike, and attempted to scan the water as he moves.

"I don't like this the fog is limiting our visibility and the water is to dark to see into. Anything could be out here." Mark said quietly in case anything dangerous was near by.

"No I've crossed this swamp before nothing lives here. The swamp's water is toxic if you drink it, so there are no crocodiles, panthers or anything else out here. Are biggest danger here is dehydration so speed is more important than defense here." Megan said before picking up her pace. Mark lowered his spear and speed up to keep up with Megan.

"So when did you come through here Megan, I mean you haven't left our side since you found us. How long ago was it?" Kate asked as she speed up so that she could walk side by side with Megan.

"I'm not sure exactly when, but it was as far back as I could remember. I just woke up remembering barely anything, I only knew my name and that I wasn't always like this." Megan said motioning to her body.

"So you didn't always have that amazing amazon body." Kate said shortly before turning red, realizing how her statement could be interpreted.

Megan looked down at her young companion and smiled innocently before continuing her story. "No, but I'm not sure what changed me. Then shortly after gaining consciousness I was hunted through the jungle by other amazons. They finally stopped chasing me when I reached the swamp".

The group presses forward as Megan details how she crossed the marsh, explored the jungle and, built her home. Three days have passed and the three continued to struggle forward despite their lack drinkable water. At this point even the disgusting, black, murky water seemed welcoming, the only thing holding the group back was the knowledge that drinking it would cause an agonizing death. The thirst had lead to conflict in the group, Mark having grown angry at the situation blamed Megan for taking them into the swamp. Kate stood up for Megan leading to the two to grow distant and causing the group to continue in tense silence. As the group approached a sandbar Mark saw something small dart through the water and over a near by hill. "I just saw something over there." Mark said raising his spear," if we catch it it will help us a little." Megan and Kate nodded and followed Mark over the hill on the sandbar. As the three cleared the top of the hill they moved right into a pool of quicksand, and were quickly pulled in up to their chests. The three struggled but they soon realized they couldn't get free on their own. Then when the group seems to have lost all hope, a wooden object is lowered to their arms. One by one they grab on and are pulled out, Megan looks up at their savior and sees that the wooded stick was.
145322111.title: Water, water everywhere.

14533.content: Jerry, age 17. Land: Mog. He is a mediocre teenager from multiple nationalities. Jerry awakes along with a group of what appears to be eight others, but there are likely more. Mog is set in a 21st century suburban district, complete with stores, houses, a couple of parks, and thousands of dead bodies. The streets and even many of the buildings are filled with week old corpses. There are no obvious signs of conflict (aside from panicking masses) or building damage, but there is little doubt that whatever force responsible for the deaths of these people may still be lurking in the shadows.
14533.title: Maybe a Post Apocalyptic Place

The world consists of a fairly large sized high school surrounded by about twenty suburban homes. One year prior to the arrival of the new Residents there was an Awakening of approximately 300 humans that range in age from eight to sixteen. Girls make up a minority of this group. The situation of this world is on the verge of meeting Lord of the Flies.

Secondary Objective: Set yourself as leader.

So you want to be a new kid.
Dude or Duddet?
After this you can be whatever you want.
1453321.title: The New Kid

choices: John is caught in the storm.
1453322.content:
John Lazarus, a strong young man with short black hair, opened his eyes, revealing their gentle blue color to find that he had awakened in a place he did not recognize. It was morning and he was resting on a low cliff, over looking a fertile valley, devoid of any human life.

"Where am I?" he asked himself.

John with the heart of an adventurer and the mind of an explorer looked about for a moment then searched his memory, trying to retrace his steps to determined how he came to be there but nothing came to mind, it was all a blank, as if everything before this day did not exist. Trying not to panic, he searched for his pockets to find he did not have any, he was wearing very simple clothing, made up of animal skins.

"Well, this is problem." he thought, looking around again.

He looked up to a rumbling sound and found that a storm was brewing in the far distance, he would have to find shelter before the storm reached him, otherwise, he would be in for a worse day than he woke up to.

"I better get moving." said John, working his way off the small cliff. "I'm not going to find any answers standing around."
he sighed, walking towards the valley. "There's bound to be clues around somewhere that will tell me where I am." he assured himself. "I just have to keep my eyes open."

With that, John walked off, into his new surroundings, using only what seemed right in respects of survival to find some shelter before the storm...
1453322.title: John Lazarus

14533221.content:
Coming across a few fallen trees, John saw a potential shelter. Without really thinking about it, he looked about, finding some lengths of sturdy vine and used them to tie the narrow trees closer together to form a roof for a lean to. He then lifted the three fallen trees with his back, just enough, to get them onto two large stumps close by.

"That should do it." he said to himself. "Now for some dry grass and some wood before that storm hits so I don't freeze my butt off tonight."

Gathering the grass and, twigs, and small branches that were lying about, John got back to the lean to, just in time to beat the rain as it began to come down in buckets. John then an old trick of rubbing sticks together to make a small fire, again without really thinking about it. Thunder rumbled overhead as John laid down next to the small fire, thankful that he was able to find shelter in time.

"Tomorrow, I will have to find some food and water." he said to himself. "Otherwise, I am not going to last long in this strange place, where ever it is."

John watched the storm rage overhead and got the idea of catching some of the water but he had no idea how he was going to do it...
14533221.title: John finds/makes shelter in time.

1511121.content:
Among the myriad races and species of the world, the ponies of Equestria, along with all of their close cousins on the phylogenetic tree (kirin, hippogriffs/seaponies, changelings, breezies, etc.) share a peculiar trait that, for some, would be considered either highly arousing or highly disturbing.

Namely, the ability of their females to somehow completely engulf another with their nethers and store them safely within their wombs. Yes, even the small ones.

Such an ability has been known to have been used offensively, for protection, for serving justice, for recreational or pleasurable purposes, and a plethora of other uses.

It is possible for a mare to regress any creature contained inside her uterus all the way back to the ovum state and store them inside the ovaries, though this practice is somewhat rare and not particularly well-known.

1553.content:
Delbang, age 18. Land: Vershtae. Delbang is a humanoid who has yet to choose its gender in life. It has an athletic body, above average height, the greenest of green eyes, and a few mysterious abilities. Vershtae consists of farmland, a few lakes, a large forest, and a fairly generic medieval village. The preachers at the local church have foretold the coming of a savior who would lead them beyond the Great Wall. If the preachers believe Delbang to be this savior, they may do anything and everything in their power to control him.
         Safame, age 21. Land Brage. Safame is a naga woman 10ft from head to ground. She has large D cup breast, full lips, and blue eyes as deep as any sea. Her light green skin and dark green hair and scales grant her excellent camouflage in the jungle that is Brage. Scattered throughout this land are a dozen or so villages of varying sizes with a walled city in the middle. The settlements are occupied by highly superstitious humans who may regard Sefame as a blessing or a curse. Fortunately, these are issues that must be dealt with in the future. The present however, has a much more pressing issue: a naga’s hunger.
1553.title: The Neuter or the Naga

15532.content:
Primary Objective: Hunt, Make Contact With the People, and Survive for Ten Years
Secondary Objective: Make a Friend, Fight off a Threat
Bonus: Become a Leader

         The forest was unusually quiet that night. The beasts did not howl and the birds did not sing their night songs. In a sizable clearing about halfway between the northern-most village of Kadar and Mt Zen, a beam of light from the full moon shined upon Brage’s latest Resident.
         Local beasts looked out from their various shelters and stared in wonder at this great shining mass. Her movement was so subtle and her sounds so quiet that it wasn’t long before all manner of beasts moved into the clearing for a better look. Most of her body was covered in glistening scales, but atop her snake like coils rested the equally familiar shape of a human.
         A distant rustle in the brush caused the animals to scramble back for cover. A band of humans were moving through the forest. With an abundance of nocturnal dangers in Brage, there were only so many reasons for humans to travel at night and most weren’t exactly pleasant. In any case, their collective voices were causing the naga to stir.
         Who do you follow?
15532.title: A Naga Called Sefame

info.brief_description: Let's get crazy with some cartoon characters, new and old.
info.description:
Inspired by the brilliant works of https://www.writing.com/main/portfolio/view/fearboy Chaos, I’ve decided to give things my own spin, only this time with the focus on western cartoons.

The listed tags are mostly just guidelines. If you want some unbirth somewhere along a vore thread, feel free. I want people to be free to have fun, though I will be setting quality standards.

1) Please avoid one sentence chapters unless you follow them immediately with something more substantial.
2) You ought to have good grammar.
3) I maintain the right to alter the rules and make changes as need be.
4) Please avoid killing, as that's no fun for anyone.
5) Please include as many options as possible.

Other than that, go wild.
info.pretty_title: Cartoon Vore, GTS, Shrink, and All Else
